00028 #include <libcfs/libcfs.h>
00029 #include <lustre/lustre_errno.h>
00030 
00031 #ifdef LUSTRE_TRANSLATE_ERRNOS
00032 
00033 /*
00034  * The two translation tables below must define a one-to-one mapping between
00035  * host and network errnos.
00036  *
00037  * EWOULDBLOCK is equal to EAGAIN on all architectures except for parisc, which
00038  * appears irrelevant.  Thus, existing references to EWOULDBLOCK are fine.
00039  *
00040  * EDEADLOCK is equal to EDEADLK on x86 but not on sparc, at least.  A sparc
00041  * host has no context-free way to determine if a LUSTRE_EDEADLK represents an
00042  * EDEADLK or an EDEADLOCK.  Therefore, all existing references to EDEADLOCK
00043  * that need to be transferred on wire have been replaced with EDEADLK.
00044  */
00045 static int lustre_errno_hton_mapping[] = {
00046         [EPERM]                 = LUSTRE_EPERM,
00047         [ENOENT]                = LUSTRE_ENOENT,
00048         [ESRCH]                 = LUSTRE_ESRCH,
00049         [EINTR]                 = LUSTRE_EINTR,
00050         [EIO]                   = LUSTRE_EIO,
00051         [ENXIO]                 = LUSTRE_ENXIO,
00052         [E2BIG]                 = LUSTRE_E2BIG,
00053         [ENOEXEC]               = LUSTRE_ENOEXEC,
00054         [EBADF]                 = LUSTRE_EBADF,
00055         [ECHILD]                = LUSTRE_ECHILD,

00057         [ENOMEM]                = LUSTRE_ENOMEM,

00336 
00337 unsigned int lustre_errno_hton(unsigned int h)
00338 {
00339         unsigned int n;
00340 
00341         if (h == 0) {
00342                 n = 0;
00343         } else if (h < ARRAY_SIZE(lustre_errno_hton_mapping)) {
00344                 n = lustre_errno_hton_mapping[h];
00345                 if (n == 0)
00346                         goto generic;
00347         } else {
00348 generic:
00349                 /*
00350                  * A generic errno is better than the unknown one that could
00351                  * mean anything to a different host.
00352                  */
00353                 n = LUSTRE_EIO;
00354         }
00355 
00356         return n;
00357 }
00358 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_errno_hton);
00359 
00360 unsigned int lustre_errno_ntoh(unsigned int n)
00361 {
00362         unsigned int h;
00363 
00364         if (n == 0) {
00365                 h = 0;
00366         } else if (n < ARRAY_SIZE(lustre_errno_ntoh_mapping)) {
00367                 h = lustre_errno_ntoh_mapping[n];
00368                 if (h == 0)
00369                         goto generic;
00370         } else {
00371 generic:
00372                 /*
00373                  * Similar to the situation in lustre_errno_hton(), an unknown
00374                  * network errno could coincide with anything.  Hence, it is
00375                  * better to return a generic errno.
00376                  */
00377                 h = EIO;
00378         }
00379 
00380         return h;
00381 }
00382 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_errno_ntoh);
00383 
00384 #endif /* LUSTRE_TRANSLATE_ERRNOS */
